title: Planet of Fire
dialogue_triumphs: I don't know how long it'll be before the next emission.
goofs: Peri is dry by the time Turlough brings her into the TARDIS.
The Doctor asks Amyand and Sorasta about Logar, despite having never heard the name before.
Peri can override the Master's control of Kamelion, but the Doctor can't.
If the Master's gun is a tissue compression eliminator, why does it compress Kamelion and the radiation suits?
Peri seems to be able to out-run its blast in episode three.

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor
continuity_notes.description: The main protagonist, a Time Lord who travels through time and space.
continuity_notes.current_status: Investigating events on Sarn and confronting the Master

continuity_notes.name: Peri Brown
continuity_notes.description: A young American student, new companion to the Doctor
continuity_notes.current_status: On holiday in Lanzarote, joins the Doctor's adventures

continuity_notes.name: Turlough
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's companion, revealed to be from planet Trion
continuity_notes.current_status: Discovers his origins and family history on Sarn

continuity_notes.name: The Master
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's nemesis, a renegade Time Lord
continuity_notes.current_status: In a weakened state, seeking regeneration through numismaton gas

continuity_notes.name: Kamelion
continuity_notes.description: A shape-shifting android companion of the Doctor
continuity_notes.current_status: Under partial control of the Master

continuity_notes.name: Numismaton Gas
continuity_notes.description: A rare catalytic reagent with great healing properties
continuity_notes.current_status: Sought after by the Master for regeneration

technobabble: Numismaton gas, 'an immensely rare catalytic reagent' with great healing properties
Comparator (full of silicon chips and resistors)
roots: References to Judaism (the penalties that await trespassers on the holy Mountain of Fire)
Christianity (the messianic 'Outsider', Timanov's reference to oblation, and the Doctor postulating on the Master's desire to be 'born again')
links: The story directly follows 'Resurrection of the Daleks'
Kamelion is seen for the first time since 'The King's Demons'
The Doctor briefly dons his half-moon spectacles (see 'Frontios')
Numismaton gas properties (see 'The Brain of Morbius')
The Master removing the temporal stabiliser (see 'Time Flight': 'Another old trick of the Master's')

locations.name: Lanzarote
locations.description: A volcanic island where the story begins
locations.current_status: Holiday destination where Peri meets the Doctor

locations.name: Sarn
locations.description: A volcanic planet with Trion exiles and indigenous population
locations.current_status: On the brink of destruction due to volcanic activity

additional_notes: The presence of the Trion distress signal device in a sunken wreck similar to the English Mary Rose is not explained, nor is the Master's familiarity with it.
bottom_line: Peri comes across very well in her first story with good lines, but the story as a whole is less than the sum of its parts. Not a great deal happens, but it is competently written, and the location filming is excellent.
